Params[3]: Rawrgh!
As the last Corrupted falls, the blue-hued space falls silent once again. Several tropical fish stare at the uninvited "guests" through the thick glass that houses them.
Threats cleared. No more hostile signals detected.
How is the life detector running?
It's set to upload the scans automatically at set intervals. Look.
Chiko looks down at her terminal and finds a new imaging document there.
However, there are also multiple obstructions interfering with the signals within the detector's range. There is no way to pinpoint the location of a specific target.
Chiko nods and continues asking.
How's the hacking on the surveillance authorization going?
...She hears no answers, just the sound of the Purifying Force members moving around.
What's the status on the cameras?
Chiko raises her voice.
Why are you kicking me, Norris?
She can hear the mumbling from the back of the team.
Chiko sighs, frustrated by how badly her team is working together.
Almost every member of the Purifying Force is used to working alone. There has never been an operation that requires a team of more than five ever since the Purifying Force was formed.
Not to mention that the Purifying Force has enlisted many members from other squads, as well as new recruits fresh out of school, leading to the current situation.
I'm sorry. Were you asking for me, Vice-Captain?
Chiko takes a deep breath and calms herself, asking the same question the third time.
Have we gotten access to the cameras?
C-copy that, Vice-Captain. The hacking operation hasn't been completed yet at the moment...
A brief commotion of panic comes from the back. A young Construct is staring at the terminal, his fingers flying all over the keyboard.
His name is printed on the custom terminal—Delapoer.
The security system here isn't using the popular encryption method from the Golden Age. It's a bit difficult to crack it from the outside...
But if you can give me another 15 minutes... no, 10 minutes...
Looking at the corpses on the floor and her injured teammate, Chiko contemplates for a moment.
That's longer than we can afford. We've encountered five Corrupted attacks already. Who can say when the next one's coming?
How long will it take if we hack it from an access point within the administrative room?
Copy that, Vice-Captain... If I have access to the administrative room, I can transfer the virus directly to reset the system authorization.
I'm adjusting our objective. Prioritize making our way to the administrative room and access to the cameras.
And stop saying "copy that" before every sentence, rookie. We don't need your habits from boot camp in the field.
Copy—Understood, Vice-Captain.

But our mission here is to search for the Red-Tide-worshipping cult "Scarlet Revelation" that got tricked here by the Ascendants. The higher-ups won't be happy if we get sidetracked and get them killed.
If they were indeed tricked here by the Ascendants as the intel said, they could be monitoring us right now.
It's already unusual that this "Copperfield Aquarium" is still running. We should at least get the security cameras on our side.
Pack up, team! Check your ammo and prepare to go.
Roger!
Hey, stop spacing out. Get your stuff and be ready to go.
Ah?! Don't startle me, Norris...
Why on earth did you apply for the Purifying Force if you're so easily scared...
And what's wrong with you today? You can usually hack into small cameras like this just with your toes! Are you getting stage fright joining a big operation for the first time?

Or is the customized terminal I gave you not to your liking? I remember that you used to need the same pillow or you couldn't sleep well. Aren't you still using Sleeping Pod 3? Does it apply to terminals as well?
My toes... Stop exaggerating...
Delapoer shakes his head, bombarded by his terrible friend's endless questions.
The terminal is great. Like I said, the encryption here is uncommon.
Delapoer looks confused as he says that.
But most assets Copperfield left on the surface use the same encryption method. This is the first time I've seen something like this.
Maybe the guy was getting creative that day... or perhaps the Ascendants altered the encryption, haha...
Delapoer shivers, quickly covering Norris' mouth.
Knock on wood! I don't want to see any Ascendants today!
You're part of the Purifying Force now. Sooner or later you'll run into them.
Norris easily removes his hold and rests a hand on his shoulder instead, speaking to him earnestly.
This is part of growing up, you know?
You talk like you had met an Ascendant before...

Delapoer knows the person before him. Had Norris survived an encounter with an Ascendant with an intact speech module, Delapoer would have had to disable his own audio module, or he would never have heard the end of it.
Haha! Even though a new Ascendant pops up every other day, and many of them showed up during the Kowloong War, I still haven't met one! I'm kind of lucky, I guess.
My luck has to continue, right?
What are you still doing there, Norris?
I have to go.
Norris pats Delapoer on his shoulder as he walks past his friend.
Don't you worry even if we run into Ascendants. You specialists are rare in the Purifying Force.
You'll be safe with us in the front.
And Vice-Captain is with us, too. Not the best reputation, sure, but her skills on the battlefield are unmatched.
So stop being such a sourpuss.
How can you tell how I feel through my mask?
Hahaha! I know how you feel even if you're an abstract piece of art—
BANG!
A bullet lands right next to where Norris is standing. The squad leader urging Norris to return to his post is pointing a gun at him, with smoke still coming out of the barrel.
N-O-R-R-I-S!
I'm coming!
By the way, I've requested a transferal to your squad after this mission. We can watch each other's back in the future.
With that, Norris rushes to the front of the troop. Delapoer sighs, looking at Norris getting further and further away.
Don't you jinx it.
Packing up his terminal, Delapoer looks up casually and finds the tropical fish in the tank staring at the troop of Purifying Force members.
This antique of a facility from the Golden Age is still running without issues, even to this day.
Out of nowhere, Delapoer suddenly wonders if the fish in there consider the humans some aliens trapped in their own glass cages.

The members of "Scarlet Revelation" believe the dead are reborn in the Red Ttide. Since it retains their memories, data, and consciousness, the Red Tide Projections are considered echoes of their lives.
The difference in their forms and living habitats makes it impossible for them to communicate. Just as how fish cannot understand humans, humans cannot understand the lives in the Red Tide...
(Wait a minute...)
(Why is there fish in there?)
The facility might have been running, but how could the fish survive this long without anyone to look after them?
This is a well-maintained graveyard, but a graveyard nonetheless. There should be nothing but rotten corpses inside.
Delapoer walks away from his team, slowly walking toward the group of fish that has been staring at him. The closer he gets, the closer the fish approaches.
Thousands of fish adhere to the glass on one side, their eyes forming a giant insect-like compound eye, the gaps between the eyeballs filled by their colorful bodies.
The thousands of eyes slowly turn, tracing "Delapoer's" footsteps. "Delapoer's" reflections in them gradually expand, twist, and transform.
As the water moves and surges, his "self" in their eyes begins to melt like butter, and his "bones," "blood," and "flesh" crumple away, leaving an empty sack of skin floating in the water.
He cannot feel his feet anymore. The vaguely humanoid-shaped figure approaches the glass wall that separates water from the air.
The closer he gets, the more blissful he feels—as if every organ in his body is screaming with joy!
...anca...
His consciousness will be liberated from its cage for a sky of freedom; his body will break the chains that bound him and sprout a pair of wings.
Just a little bit closer...
Cough...
Her buried consciousness slowly rises, her sense of self reestablished.
Dust-covered corpses lie underneath her feet. The faint light from the lamp in her hand is slowly dying, and the projections in her visual module are dissolving into the air.
How are you feeling, Bianca?
The projections overlap with the figure before her. For a brief second, she cannot recognize who that is.
Calibrating her visual module, Bianca finds Lucia standing before her. Next to Lucia is a human, while other members of this operation are standing further away, keeping watch.
I'm okay. Were you the one that terminated the "Phantom Tracer", Commandant?
She looks at the now-darkened lamp and frowns.

Params[2]: Your M.I.N.D. was extremely unstable back then.
The Deep M.I.N.D. connection might not make it in time.
So I authorized to stop the tracer first.

Params[3]: That is when Bianca realizes that her M.I.N.D. is currently connected intricately through a special network. Was her M.I.N.D. deviation so severe that she did not even notice this earlier?
A timely assessment, Commandant.
After viewing some events that took place here through the Phantom Tracer, I began to experience hallucinations.
Looking at the mere handful of bionic fish in the giant fish tank, Bianca is certain that the thousands of tropical fish she saw earlier were her hallucinations.
My M.I.N.D. has stabilized now. You can stop the Deep M.I.N.D. connection, Commandant.
As the link is disconnected, Bianca hooks the lamp-shaped Phantom Tracer back on her belt.
Compared to the Spear of F.O.S., this tracer has a much higher risk of M.I.N.D. deviation.
You should rely on it less, Bianca.
At least now we know what's the longest we can use the tracer.
Asimov and Vesalius have mentioned that if we can stabilize the M.I.N.D. through a Deep M.I.N.D. connection in time, there is no fear of a M.I.N.D. deviation.
Don't worry. I'll use it responsibly.

Params[2]: This is too hasty. We're underprepared for this mission and this new frame.

Params[3]: Babylonia, 09:00 AM
Thank you for your hard work on the last mission.
You mentioned in your report that Lithos has some unique insights on the Red Tide?

Params[2]: He seems to believe that the lives taken by the Red Tide aren't completely gone.
They merely live on in another fractured form.

Params[3]: Hmm. This seems to match what Noan said...
I suspect that the incident at Copperfield Aquarium is the work of the Ascendants.
You heard me. That's where you're going next.
The truth is, the Ascendants aren't just targeting Constructs with their rumors... They have also swayed some Scavengers groups that hold similar ideals.
The projection on the bridge suddenly displays a large amount of intel and images.
It is a new group that believes the Red Tide can resurrect the dead.
From the testimonials we gathered, they were a small group of 13 before gradually expanding into a group of thousands.
The original 13 that started the group call themselves the "13 Revelationists".
They haven't done anything as fanatical as pushing or luring people into the Red Tide yet.
But, recently, the 13 Revealationists all received invitations from an unknown Ascendant one after another.
The Ascendant promised them rebirth through the Red Tide if they showed up at a specific location and passed the Ascendant's test and filtering.
Even though the 13 only considered "Rebirth through the Red Tide" a tale of solace, any comfort they could find turned into a lifeline in these desperate times.
Most of them died on their journey. The Purifying Force only found dead bodies and a handful of survivors when they arrived.
Only 1 of the 13 Revealationists survived.
A picture of a woman with dark eyeshadows appears in the projection.
Grace last appeared in Copperfield Aquarium.

Params[2]: Were the Ascendants trying to turn the people into one of them?

Params[3]: Noan mentioned that it was not humans but Lithos who turned him into a Construct. You do not know how or why, but the Ascendants also seem to possess Construct technology.
Not really. Their situations were different from Noan's.
They all tested negative for Tantalum-193 affinity in conservation areas in the past. There was no way they could become Constructs.
And we've found that the technology used on Noan's frame was more or less identical to ours apart from the anomaly in his M.I.N.D.
In theory, even the Ascendants couldn't turn them into Constructs.
Nonetheless, we couldn't just watch as our own were sacrificed for some Ascendant conspiracies.
We sent a team of Purifying Force to investigate the aquarium, but they also disappeared.
Yes.
This is Chiko. We're no longer detecting any Corrupted signals at the entrance and the surrounding one-kilometer area. Beginning the investigation on the Scarlet Revelation now.
That is the last recording we received.
We want you to continue Chiko's mission and investigate the Scarlet Revelation and what the Ascendants are after at Copperfield Aquarium.
And try to rescue as many survivors as possible.
Any questions?

Params[2]: I have one, but it's not mission-related.

Params[3]: What is it?
There are so many questions you want answers to that you have no idea where to begin. However, Hassen seems to know what you want to ask just at the mention of Lee.
I understand your worry, but I can't tell you too much yet.
But I want you to know that we're doing what we're doing to prevent another "Empyrea".
The real hope... is the people who created all of them. Your words at the Parliament didn't just impact people's opinions on the zero-point engine on the moon.
So... trust our people and give them more time.
The mood in the transport craft is dreary. Most members of the Purifying Force are not speaking. Rare, brief interactions quickly revert to silence.
You recognize some faces from previous missions, but some you do not know. They seem to be new recruits who just joined the Purifying Force.
But you are perhaps most surprised by their captain.
Bianca, your frame...
Bianca is here in a completely new form after being severely injured in the previous battle with the agent.

You are not surprised to find her as the captain of the squad. You are surprised to find her using a frame you have never seen instead of the Veritas frame while the Zero frame is under repair. Even her bow has been replaced with a Swordstaff.
Our mission takes place indoors this time. Since a bow isn't the most optimal weapon of choice, I've been provided with alternative equipment.
Noticing the confusion in your eyes, she explains the reason why she has changed her weapon.
By the way, Vesalius asked me to give this to you.
Bianca hands you a familiar-looking connection device.

Params[2]: Is this the improved Deep M.I.N.D. connection device?

Params[3]: I'll explain later. Please wear your seatbelt first, Commandant.
That's right. It's the new technology at the core of the Stigmata frame.
According to Bianca, the lamp-shaped "Phantom Tracer" can help her reconstruct the past in a set area.
The "Spear of F.O.S." that Gray Raven used could do the same as long as there are functional digital devices on the scene if this is all the tracer is for.
But...
Unlike the Spear of F.O.S., the Phantom Tracer can read part of the data stored within the Punishing Virus before deciphering it with an enhanced version of the Spear of F.O.S.

Limited by the Construct hardware, we cannot perform the same kind of analysis and simulation as a dedicated machine. A machine like that, however, is easily infected by the Punishing Virus, which limits its mobility.
The Spear of F.O.S. Asimov invented can be used by Constructs, but it only works on the data stored inside functional digital devices.
The "Phantom Tracer" fills the gap between them. Given how the surface is filled with the Punishing Virus, we can use this tracer to figure out what happened to an area in the past.
So the Punishing Virus is capable of storing data... Now that I think about it, the Red Tide Projections have proven to show similar traits.
According to the researchers, they have been investigating this property of the Punishing Virus for a long time, dating back to before even the Red Tide was first discovered.
But it wasn't until Noan's recent appearance that gave them the final piece of the puzzle.

Params[2]: Using the Phantom Tracer will lead to M.I.N.D. deviation?

Params[3]: Although you do not understand how the Phantom Tracer works, it is clear to you that deciphering information from the Punishing Virus is not as easy as clicking open a document from a terminal.
Yes. If a Deep M.I.N.D. connection isn't established after running the tracer for a certain amount of time, it can lead to permanent damage and deviation to the M.I.N.D.
And given that the deciphering process involves the Punishing Virus, establishing a Deep M.I.N.D. connection while the tracer is running exacts a heavier toll on the commandant than usual.
...We don't know yet.

Params[2]: Bianca, has Stigmata been calibrated and tested in simulations?

Params[3]: Noan only arrived on Babylonia a while ago. If the researchers were only able to complete the Phantom Tracer after Noan's appearance, then Stigmata must not have been made for long.
Given how urgent the situation is, this frame has only been briefly tested and calibrated. But we're certain that it won't damage my M.I.N.D. when we're not using the Phantom Tracer.
As for the tracer itself... There wasn't a suitable testing venue on Babylonia, and it was too late to test it on the ground.
You cannot help but clutch your fists so tight that your nails can almost pierce your palms.
The real hope... is the people who created all of them. Your words at the Parliament didn't just impact people's opinions on the zero-point engine on the moon.
So... trust our people and give them more time.
You almost have to squeeze your words out through clenched teeth.

Params[2]: President Hassen and Asimov wouldn't have agreed to this.

Params[3]: Bianca closes her eyes and does not speak until your fists eventually relax.
It was Kurono, Commandant.
They've been researching it since the Punishing Virus appeared.
